results.title: Sniffles and sneezes
results.brief_description: Explains that colds are the result of viruses, portrays common ways of spreading cold germs, and illustrates how the body defends itself against germs. Shows how to prevent colds and what to do if a cold has started.
results.description: Explains that colds are the result of viruses, portrays common ways of spreading cold germs, and illustrates how the body defends itself against germs. Shows how to prevent colds and what to do if a cold has started.

results.title: Snakes and how they live
results.brief_description: Relates major pertinent concepts about snakes, using a great variety of types to show how they move, eat, shed skin, etc. An open-ended approach stimulates class discussion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Snacks count too
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: What you eat makes a difference - proper nutrition is still a problem. This film examines the factors that lead to excess snacking and further explains the nutritive elements of popular snack foods.

results.title: Smoking: Pete Ennis doesn't smoke yet
results.brief_description: Explores the varius pressures and forces which may tend to influence an individual’s decision on whether or not to smoke. Considers the medical aspects of smoking and points out that the longer an individual smokes the harder it is for them to stop. Designed to promote discussion about smoking.
results.description: Explores the varius pressures and forces which may tend to influence an individual’s decision on whether or not to smoke. results.title: Smoking: it's your choice
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: An open-ended film designed to stimulate thought and class discussion; the aim of this film is to help young people make a decision about smoking cigarettes. Animation is used to show how smoking affects the lungs, causing diseases such as lung cancer and emphysema.

results.creator_credit: Max Reid, Jonathan Dana and Pelican Films

results.title: Smoking: a new focus
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films and Directions Unlimited
results.brief_description: Examines the problem of smoking from a medical and sociological standpoint, avoiding scare tactics and preaching. Excerpts from the Surgeon-General’s Report, an animated drawing of lung function and an explanation by Dr James Sherman substantiate the case against smoking. Traces smoking from its Spanish heritage, through the Middle East, to the New World and updates the course of events by analogies to the pollution problem. Presented by James Brolin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films and Directions Unlimited

results.title: Smoking....today's problem
results.creator_credit: Anti Cancer Council and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: Smoking is humorously debated by two adolescents and supported by interviews. Illustrates the pressures exerted on adolescents by advertising media and peer groups to encourage smoking. Emphasis is placed on the power of the individual to decide for themselves. A series of six lessons each approx 10 mins. Titles are - Pressures to smoke, Immediate and short-term effects of smoking, Smoking and disease, Resisting pressure to smoke, Advertising and Assertiveness training. No other credits available.

results.title: Smoking and you
results.creator_credit: Derrick Knight, Derrick Knight and Partners and Great Britain. Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: The risks of cigarette smoking, factually presented with the object of discouraging young smokers. Effects of smoking on the throat and lungs are explained in diagrams and illustrated by the cases of two heavy smokers; research with a smoking machine shows the amount of chemicals inhaled; and animated sequence shows the rise in smoking and the number of deaths from lung cancer since 1910.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derrick Knight, Derrick Knight and Partners and Great Britain. Ministry of Health

results.title: Smoking and kids
results.creator_credit: Bryon Meyers, Morley Skolnek and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description: Many children are caught up in peer pressures that induce them to drink, eat, inhale or inject substances that may harm them. This film provides an opportunity to bring some of the children’s problems into the open, and to think about alleviating them.
